title: Boolean Variables and Constants
description: Assess your knowledge of Boolean variables, constants, and how they behave in logical systems.

questions.question: What are the two Boolean constants?
In Boolean logic, what does the constant '0' represent?
Which of the following is a conventional Boolean variable name?
What is the main purpose of a Boolean variable?
options: To represent binary logic states: true or false

questions.question: What happens when a Boolean variable is assigned the value of 1?
Which of the following best describes the difference between Boolean constants and variables?
options: Constants can only be 0 or 1; variables can represent those values and change over time.
Variables are always true; constants are always false.
Variables are numbers; constants are logic gates.
There is no difference between them.
